summary: Title: Only Human For Pomoon on twitter! :) Pairing:  Kacchako Rating: T Word Count: 2,523 Read on Ao3 Summary:    When Bakugou...
body:
Title: Only Human
For Pomoon on twitter! :)
Pairing:  Kacchako
Rating: T
Word Count: 2,523
Read on Ao3
Summary:  

When Bakugou gets sick, Uraraka forces him to stay home from work.

Full fic under the cut! Thanks to @its-love-u-asshole for betaing <3 <3

Covering his mouth, Bakugou tried to hide the cough that threatened to slip between his lips. He wasn’t in the mood to face the wrath of his slightly overprotective girlfriend when it came to these sorts of things.

“Bakugou Katsuki just where do you think you’re going?”

He halted, frozen in place while catching the gaze of a very frustrated Uraraka Ochako. And here he thought he’d been quiet.

She was a heavy sleeper, always snoring and drooling a little bit. Disgusting, but so damn her and so damn cute. He was weak to her, and though he always tried to deny it, it was easy to see through his damn transparent lies.

Somehow, he’d woken her up in an attempt to sneak out of their apartment. Fuckin’ demon woman.

He looked her up and down, noting how she looked like she just rolled out of bed. Her brown hair was disheveled, pieces flying every which way from the back of her head. Her tank top was twisted around her stomach, the side of her breast peeking through the white fabric.

If he didn’t feel like ultra shit, he would’ve ravaged her right there against the door.

“Move Cheeks,” he snorted. “I’m going to work.”

“No, you’re not. You’re getting back into bed and calling Best Jeanist.”

He narrowed his eyes. Just because they lived together and he loved her or whatever, didn’t mean she could boss him the fuck around.

He growled, glaring at the beautiful woman in front of him. “I’m. Fine,” he hissed, the anger laced through his tone.

“You had a fever last night! The last thing you need to be doing is going into your office and getting everyone else sick!” Admittedly, he probably also had a fever right now, but like hell he was going to tell her that. It wasn’t like it was hindering him from getting shit done!

He flared his nostrils, glaring at her. “And what about you?”

“I live with you,” she snorted. “I’m immune.”

“I don’t think that’s how colds work, Cheeks,” he teased, a large grin pulled across his face.

“Even so, you’re going to get sicker if you keep going to work like this. What are you going to do when you’re feverish and collapse in the field?”

“Like hell that will happen-” he started to yell back, already feeling a little dizzy from using so much air.

Uraraka sighed and stepped closer to him. “You’re wobbling around, Katsuki,” she said and gently placed her hand on his forehead. “And you’re definitely burning up!”

He hated how gentle her her touch was and his forehead did feel clammy against her cool hand. Fuck. Bakugou Katsuki didn’t get sick, he was fucking above that. “I’m-”

“Don’t you dare try and tell me you’re fine because you’re not. I’m not letting you out of this apartment!”

“Ochako,” he growled, glaring at her still. He could go into work, get some paperwork done and be home and in bed early enough to recover from this shitty cold trying to ruin his life.

She smirked, folding her arms over her chest. “What will you do if you get everyone in your office sick? Won’t Best Jeanist be angry if you spread your cold to everyone?”

Ugh. She was right, which he hated. He would never hear the end of it if he got everyone sick. He was stubborn though and the last thing he wanted was to give in; though with the way she was starting to spin a bit, he thought his body might not give him much of a choice.

He stumbled forward and she immediately caught up, placing her palm against his chest, keeping one finger raised, threatening to activate her quirk.

“Give me your phone,” she said, gently touching at the strap on his hero costume.

“No.”

“Phone…”

“No.”

“Katsuki.”

“Ochako.”

“Phone. You know if I use my quirk on you it might make you feel even worse.” She lowered her finger, looking as though she was about to tap his chest. The idea of floating currently sounded awful, so Bakugou huffed, pulling out his phone.

She yanked it from his hand and scrolled through his contacts, tapping at the screen. “Hello, this Uravity calling on behalf of Ground Zero,” she said. “He’s running a high fever and will not be coming into work today.” There was a brief pause and if Bakugou didn’t feel so damn groggy he might’ve been able to try and figure out what Best Jeanist was saying. His low tone echoed on the other end of the phone and Bakugou hated that the idiot was probably pleased Uraraka convinced him to not come in. “Oh! No need to thank me,” she giggled, confirming Bakugou’s thoughts. “Yes, I’ll take good care of him.”

“Oi!” he growled, reaching for his phone, however Uraraka held her hand up, pushing his hands away. He could fucking take care of himself, even if he was sick. But before he could even grab for the phone, Uraraka tapped the end call button, handing him back the device.

“He’s grateful you’re listening to me for once.”

“For once!” he snorted. “I listen to you all the damn time, Ochako!”

“Right,” she scoffed. “So now will you listen to me about getting back into bed?”

He yanked his large grenade gloves off and slammed them back into the closet. “Fine, but you better not touch my kitchen!” he muttered, feeling woozy just thinking about eating something gross she might make.

“Oh come on, even I can heat up some soup,” she said.

He really wasn’t so sure about that.

He reached out and grabbed the chair to their dining set and plopped down in the seat, coughing at his full volume. His chest was tight and his head did feel like it was clogged.

“See! You’re dying!” she said, rushing to the stove. She grabbed a small pot and some canned soup from the cabinet. “Maybe I should make tea too.”

“Ugh…” he grunted, letting his head fall to his arms, burying himself against the table.

“You’re lucky today is my day off,” she said, humming while she added water into the pot, getting the soup ready.

Lucky was one word for it.

“It’s kinda nice, you know,” she smiled, gently stirring the soup in the pot, letting it simmer gently on the stove.

“What? Me fuckin’ dying!”

“Oh, so you admit it?” she hummed, turning around to raise her eyebrow at him.

He rolled his eyes and glared at her. “I didn’t go to work, did I?”

She couldn’t help but laugh at how angry he was. He hated that her laugh made him feel a little bit warmer despite the fever sending chills up and down his entire body. “I had to force you to not go!” she said, pulling a bowl from the cabinet. “Anyway,” she hummed, “I like having the chance to take care of my boyfriend.”

Ew. He hated that. He didn’t need to be taken care of. They took care of each other plenty, on equal footing. He wasn’t some child that she needed to coddle and treat like a baby. Fuck that.

“Forget the soup,” he snarled, pushing the chair out to stand up.

“What? But it’s almost done!” she said.

“I don’t need you to fuckin’… take care of me!” he snapped, pushing the chair back into the table.

“Oh Katsuki…” she sighed, moving the soup off of the burner. She slowly made her way over to him and took his hand. “I didn’t mean to offend you. I love you and I wanted you to feel better and I was happy that I could maybe try and do something to help you.”

He growled, squeezing her hand back. “You know I…” he trailed off, coughing once more. The awful feeling burned in his chest.

“Hate feeling useless?” she said, finishing his sentence.

“…Fuck…”

“You’re not useless, Katsuki!” she giggled. “You’re sick! It happens to everyone. Please just eat this soup.”

He took a seat back at the table and rolled his eyes. He hated this. Fuck, he hated it so much. He hated that she was doing so much shit for him on her day off and that his arms felt like lead and he wanted to drag his goddamn feet everywhere.

Being sick was the worst… especially because he rarely fucking got sick and when he did, it felt like a ton of bricks were slamming into his chest over and over.

She placed the bowl and spoon in front of him and took a seat across from him. He also hated the concern in her gentle, brown eyes. He didn’t need her looking so worried, then she was certain to get sick herself.

“Will you quit… worryin’…” he muttered, slurping up the soup. He wrinkled his nose. How could this girl mess up easy-make soup? It was far too watery.

“Is it not good?” she asked, more concern fluttering across her eyes. He couldn’t keep having her look at him like this so he just needed to suffer even more.

He slurped it down, and shook his head. “S'fine, Cheeks. Stop looking at me like I’m dying of the plague.”

“You kinda are…” she teased, gently poking at his hand with her finger. “I seriously think you should consider going to the doctor if you’re not better in a day or two,” she hummed, her tone taking on a slight sing song. “But knowing you, you won’t do it,” she shrugged.

“Whatever,” he grumbled. The last thing he wanted to do what go to the stupid doctor. He pushed the now empty bowl away from him and stood back up.

“Where are you going?”

“I dunno, I might take a nap or some shit,” he muttered.

“Well take some medicine before you go,” she said, scurrying over to the small cabinet where they kept a few bottles of aspirin and cold medication. “Remember when you thought you wouldn’t ever need these?”

“I still don’t really fuckin’ need them!” he snapped.

“Stop being so damn stubborn!” she yelled, thrusting the pulls into his hand. “Just take them and get some rest!”

“Fine! I fuckin’ get it!” He tossed the pills into his mouth and threw back a large glass of water, swallowing it.

Napping did seem like a much better alternative suddenly. Uraraka was going to keep yelling at him if he didn’t listen to her. Why didn’t he have a quirk to make himself magically better instead of suffering through this stupid disease?

He just hated being treated like he was fuckin’ dying.

Making his way back to their bedroom, he flopped onto the bed, pulling the blankets over his body. “Now go away. You got what you fucking wanted.” He turned away from her, huffing out angrily while she stood in the doorway.

She sighed, slowly walking forward to sit down on the side of the bed, tucking strands of her hair behind her ear. She reached forward and gently stroked through his messy blond locks, her fingers gently massaging his scalp. “Katsuki…” she whispered. “You know I do it because I’m worried about you. If you went out in the field like this, you could be seriously injured or over work your body too much…” she explained.

He groaned, rolling his eyes. The problem was she was right and Bakugou hated that she was right and he just wanted to do his job and not feel like a goddamn fucking invalid.

The medicine was already starting to make him drowsy, but he rolled over, turning back to face her. “I get it Cheeks. I just… fuckin’ hate being sick.”

“I know,” she said. “You don’t like feeling useless. But… Katsuki…” She lifted the covers up and slid herself underneath with him. She brushed her soft fingers over his cheek, smiling at him. “You’re only human. Sometimes I think you forget that,” she teased.

She wasn’t wrong. He didn’t view himself as human. He was a goddamn hero, and he worked hard to be one. He worked hard to push himself to be the best he could be… and yeah, maybe this was his body’s way of telling him to slow down.

He gently grabbed her wrist, pulling her hand to his lips, kissing her palm. “I don’t want to be human,” he grumbled.

“Too bad,” she giggled, scooting even close to him, rubbing her nose against his. “You are. And if you’re sick… it’s okay to ask for help.”

“Ugh. Whatever Cheeks. I guess… if anyone is gonna be doing this shit for me… I’m… glad it’s you…” he muttered, the words more painful to say than the headache he was nursing.

She blushed, and he at the very least thought the words were worth saying, if only to see the cute look on her face. He hated the idea of asking for help, but if anyone was going to do it, he would want it to be her. She was his partner, his equal, and no one knew him better than she did.

“It’s fine. I’ll help you, even if you hate it a lot,” she teased, gently pressing her lips to his, kissing him gently. For a moment, he returned the kiss, loving her soft lips on his own, but suddenly, he remembered that he was sick and immediately pushed her back.

“Oi! You’re gonna get sick, idiot!” he growled. The last thing he wanted was her catching this.

“I told you! As your girlfriend, I’m immune.”

~~

Well, that was a big fat lie.

Only a few days later, Uraraka awoke with a heavy cough and slight fever. Shivering, she pressed against him.

“Oi, Ochako… you’re sick.”

His cold hadn’t completely disappeared either, his nose was still a little stuffed and his cough had lingered.

“Maybe you’re right…” she mumbled, nuzzling against his neck, her gloved hands pressing close to his chest.

“You’re not going to work today,” he stated, doing the same thing she did to him a few days prior.

“Okay,” she said softly, her eyes closing against him. That was far too easy. Though then again, she did seem utterly exhausted, the cold hitting her hard.

He smirked. “What happened to being immune?” he teased, gently stroking through her brown locks

“Mmm…guess I was wrong,” she whispered. “Now you can take care of me.”

He rolled his eyes. “Was this a secret plan of yours to be lazy in bed?”

“What!? No!” she said, a coughing fit picking up. “Do you really think I would fake sick for that?”

“Just teasin’ Cheeks,” he muttered and kissed her forehead.

“Mean,” she sighed, yawning as she sniffled against him, already drifting off back into sleep, the cold making her shiver more. He knew she probably needed to take some of that cold medicine, which meant she also needed to eat.

“Hey,” he whispered, chuckling to himself. “At least I make better soup than you.” She groaned, weakly hitting her hand against his chest.

In the end, he supposed they did take perfect care of each other.

Pairing:  Kacchako
Rating: T
Word Count: 2,523
Read on Ao3
Summary:

“Bakugou Katsuki just where do you think you’re going?”

He halted, frozen in place while catching the gaze of a very frustrated Uraraka Ochako. And here he thought he’d been quiet.

[[MORE]]

She was a heavy sleeper, always snoring and drooling a little bit. Disgusting, but so damn her and so damn cute. He was weak to her, and though he always tried to deny it, it was easy to see through his damn transparent lies.

Somehow, he’d woken her up in an attempt to sneak out of their apartment. Fuckin’ demon woman.

He looked her up and down, noting how she looked like she just rolled out of bed. Her brown hair was disheveled, pieces flying every which way from the back of her head. Her tank top was twisted around her stomach, the side of her breast peeking through the white fabric.

If he didn’t feel like ultra shit, he would’ve ravaged her right there against the door.

“Move Cheeks,” he snorted. “I’m going to work.”

“No, you’re not. You’re getting back into bed and calling Best Jeanist.”

He narrowed his eyes. Just because they lived together and he loved her or whatever, didn’t mean she could boss him the fuck around.

He growled, glaring at the beautiful woman in front of him. “I’m. Fine,” he hissed, the anger laced through his tone.

“You had a fever last night! The last thing you need to be doing is going into your office and getting everyone else sick!” Admittedly, he probably also had a fever right now, but like hell he was going to tell her that. It wasn’t like it was hindering him from getting shit done!

He flared his nostrils, glaring at her. “And what about you?”

“I live with you,” she snorted. “I’m immune.”

“I don’t think that’s how colds work, Cheeks,” he teased, a large grin pulled across his face.

“Even so, you’re going to get sicker if you keep going to work like this. What are you going to do when you’re feverish and collapse in the field?”

“Like hell that will happen-” he started to yell back, already feeling a little dizzy from using so much air.

Uraraka sighed and stepped closer to him. “You’re wobbling around, Katsuki,” she said and gently placed her hand on his forehead. “And you’re definitely burning up!”

He hated how gentle her her touch was and his forehead did feel clammy against her cool hand. Fuck. Bakugou Katsuki didn’t get sick, he was fucking above that. “I’m-”

“Don’t you dare try and tell me you’re fine because you’re not. I’m not letting you out of this apartment!”

“Ochako,” he growled, glaring at her still. He could go into work, get some paperwork done and be home and in bed early enough to recover from this shitty cold trying to ruin his life.

She smirked, folding her arms over her chest. “What will you do if you get everyone in your office sick? Won’t Best Jeanist be angry if you spread your cold to everyone?”

Ugh. She was right, which he hated. He would never hear the end of it if he got everyone sick. He was stubborn though and the last thing he wanted was to give in; though with the way she was starting to spin a bit, he thought his body might not give him much of a choice.

He stumbled forward and she immediately caught up, placing her palm against his chest, keeping one finger raised, threatening to activate her quirk.

“Give me your phone,” she said, gently touching at the strap on his hero costume.

“No.”

“Phone…”

“No.”

“Katsuki.”

“Ochako.”

“Phone. You know if I use my quirk on you it might make you feel even worse.” She lowered her finger, looking as though she was about to tap his chest. The idea of floating currently sounded awful, so Bakugou huffed, pulling out his phone.

She yanked it from his hand and scrolled through his contacts, tapping at the screen. “Hello, this Uravity calling on behalf of Ground Zero,” she said. “He’s running a high fever and will not be coming into work today.” There was a brief pause and if Bakugou didn’t feel so damn groggy he might’ve been able to try and figure out what Best Jeanist was saying. His low tone echoed on the other end of the phone and Bakugou hated that the idiot was probably pleased Uraraka convinced him to not come in. “Oh! No need to thank me,” she giggled, confirming Bakugou’s thoughts. “Yes, I’ll take good care of him.”

“Oi!” he growled, reaching for his phone, however Uraraka held her hand up, pushing his hands away. He could fucking take care of himself, even if he was sick. But before he could even grab for the phone, Uraraka tapped the end call button, handing him back the device.

“He’s grateful you’re listening to me for once.”

“For once!” he snorted. “I listen to you all the damn time, Ochako!”

“Right,” she scoffed. “So now will you listen to me about getting back into bed?”

He yanked his large grenade gloves off and slammed them back into the closet. “Fine, but you better not touch my kitchen!” he muttered, feeling woozy just thinking about eating something gross she might make.

“Oh come on, even I can heat up some soup,” she said.

He really wasn’t so sure about that.

He reached out and grabbed the chair to their dining set and plopped down in the seat, coughing at his full volume. His chest was tight and his head did feel like it was clogged.

“See! You’re dying!” she said, rushing to the stove. She grabbed a small pot and some canned soup from the cabinet. “Maybe I should make tea too.”

“Ugh…” he grunted, letting his head fall to his arms, burying himself against the table.

“You’re lucky today is my day off,” she said, humming while she added water into the pot, getting the soup ready.

Lucky was one word for it.

“It’s kinda nice, you know,” she smiled, gently stirring the soup in the pot, letting it simmer gently on the stove.

“What? Me fuckin’ dying!”

“Oh, so you admit it?” she hummed, turning around to raise her eyebrow at him.

He rolled his eyes and glared at her. “I didn’t go to work, did I?”

She couldn’t help but laugh at how angry he was. He hated that her laugh made him feel a little bit warmer despite the fever sending chills up and down his entire body. “I had to force you to not go!” she said, pulling a bowl from the cabinet. “Anyway,” she hummed, “I like having the chance to take care of my boyfriend.”

Ew. He hated that. He didn’t need to be taken care of. They took care of each other plenty, on equal footing. He wasn’t some child that she needed to coddle and treat like a baby. Fuck that.

“Forget the soup,” he snarled, pushing the chair out to stand up.

“What? But it’s almost done!” she said.

“I don’t need you to fuckin’… take care of me!” he snapped, pushing the chair back into the table.

“Oh Katsuki…” she sighed, moving the soup off of the burner. She slowly made her way over to him and took his hand. “I didn’t mean to offend you. I love you and I wanted you to feel better and I was happy that I could maybe try and do something to help you.”

He growled, squeezing her hand back. “You know I…” he trailed off, coughing once more. The awful feeling burned in his chest.

“Hate feeling useless?” she said, finishing his sentence.

“…Fuck…”

“You’re not useless, Katsuki!” she giggled. “You’re sick! It happens to everyone. Please just eat this soup.”

He took a seat back at the table and rolled his eyes. He hated this. Fuck, he hated it so much. He hated that she was doing so much shit for him on her day off and that his arms felt like lead and he wanted to drag his goddamn feet everywhere.

Being sick was the worst… especially because he rarely fucking got sick and when he did, it felt like a ton of bricks were slamming into his chest over and over.

She placed the bowl and spoon in front of him and took a seat across from him. He also hated the concern in her gentle, brown eyes. He didn’t need her looking so worried, then she was certain to get sick herself.

“Will you quit… worryin’…” he muttered, slurping up the soup. He wrinkled his nose. How could this girl mess up easy-make soup? It was far too watery.

“Is it not good?” she asked, more concern fluttering across her eyes. He couldn’t keep having her look at him like this so he just needed to suffer even more.

He slurped it down, and shook his head. “S'fine, Cheeks. Stop looking at me like I’m dying of the plague.”

“You kinda are…” she teased, gently poking at his hand with her finger. “I seriously think you should consider going to the doctor if you’re not better in a day or two,” she hummed, her tone taking on a slight sing song. “But knowing you, you won’t do it,” she shrugged.

“Whatever,” he grumbled. The last thing he wanted to do what go to the stupid doctor. He pushed the now empty bowl away from him and stood back up.

“Where are you going?”

“I dunno, I might take a nap or some shit,” he muttered.

“Well take some medicine before you go,” she said, scurrying over to the small cabinet where they kept a few bottles of aspirin and cold medication. “Remember when you thought you wouldn’t ever need these?”

“I still don’t really fuckin’ need them!” he snapped.

“Stop being so damn stubborn!” she yelled, thrusting the pulls into his hand. “Just take them and get some rest!”

“Fine! I fuckin’ get it!” He tossed the pills into his mouth and threw back a large glass of water, swallowing it.

Napping did seem like a much better alternative suddenly. Uraraka was going to keep yelling at him if he didn’t listen to her. Why didn’t he have a quirk to make himself magically better instead of suffering through this stupid disease?

He just hated being treated like he was fuckin’ dying.

Making his way back to their bedroom, he flopped onto the bed, pulling the blankets over his body. “Now go away. You got what you fucking wanted.” He turned away from her, huffing out angrily while she stood in the doorway.

She sighed, slowly walking forward to sit down on the side of the bed, tucking strands of her hair behind her ear. She reached forward and gently stroked through his messy blond locks, her fingers gently massaging his scalp. “Katsuki…” she whispered. “You know I do it because I’m worried about you. If you went out in the field like this, you could be seriously injured or over work your body too much…” she explained.

He groaned, rolling his eyes. The problem was she was right and Bakugou hated that she was right and he just wanted to do his job and not feel like a goddamn fucking invalid.

The medicine was already starting to make him drowsy, but he rolled over, turning back to face her. “I get it Cheeks. I just… fuckin’ hate being sick.”

“I know,” she said. “You don’t like feeling useless. But… Katsuki…” She lifted the covers up and slid herself underneath with him. She brushed her soft fingers over his cheek, smiling at him. “You’re only human. Sometimes I think you forget that,” she teased.

She wasn’t wrong. He didn’t view himself as human. He was a goddamn hero, and he worked hard to be one. He worked hard to push himself to be the best he could be… and yeah, maybe this was his body’s way of telling him to slow down.

He gently grabbed her wrist, pulling her hand to his lips, kissing her palm. “I don’t want to be human,” he grumbled.

“Too bad,” she giggled, scooting even close to him, rubbing her nose against his. “You are. And if you’re sick… it’s okay to ask for help.”

“Ugh. Whatever Cheeks. I guess… if anyone is gonna be doing this shit for me… I’m… glad it’s you…” he muttered, the words more painful to say than the headache he was nursing.

She blushed, and he at the very least thought the words were worth saying, if only to see the cute look on her face. He hated the idea of asking for help, but if anyone was going to do it, he would want it to be her. She was his partner, his equal, and no one knew him better than she did.

“It’s fine. I’ll help you, even if you hate it a lot,” she teased, gently pressing her lips to his, kissing him gently. For a moment, he returned the kiss, loving her soft lips on his own, but suddenly, he remembered that he was sick and immediately pushed her back.

“Oi! You’re gonna get sick, idiot!” he growled. The last thing he wanted was her catching this.

“I told you! As your girlfriend, I’m immune.”

~~

Well, that was a big fat lie.

Only a few days later, Uraraka awoke with a heavy cough and slight fever. Shivering, she pressed against him.

“Oi, Ochako… you’re sick.”

His cold hadn’t completely disappeared either, his nose was still a little stuffed and his cough had lingered.

“Maybe you’re right…” she mumbled, nuzzling against his neck, her gloved hands pressing close to his chest.

“You’re not going to work today,” he stated, doing the same thing she did to him a few days prior.

“Okay,” she said softly, her eyes closing against him. That was far too easy. Though then again, she did seem utterly exhausted, the cold hitting her hard.

He smirked. “What happened to being immune?” he teased, gently stroking through her brown locks

“Mmm…guess I was wrong,” she whispered. “Now you can take care of me.”

He rolled his eyes. “Was this a secret plan of yours to be lazy in bed?”

“What!? No!” she said, a coughing fit picking up. “Do you really think I would fake sick for that?”

“Just teasin’ Cheeks,” he muttered and kissed her forehead.

“Mean,” she sighed, yawning as she sniffled against him, already drifting off back into sleep, the cold making her shiver more. He knew she probably needed to take some of that cold medicine, which meant she also needed to eat.

“Hey,” he whispered, chuckling to himself. “At least I make better soup than you.” She groaned, weakly hitting her hand against his chest.

In the end, he supposed they did take perfect care of each other.

Title: Only Human
For Pomoon on twitter! :)
Pairing:  Kacchako
Rating: T
Word Count: 2,523
Read on Ao3
Summary:  

When Bakugou gets sick, Uraraka forces him to stay home from work.

Full fic under the cut! Thanks to @its-love-u-asshole for betaing <3 <3

blog.description: Welcome to Heights Alliance! We're a canon and OC friendly My Hero Academia roleplaying server seeking active 16+ members!

summary: Stay at Heights Alliance! Heights Alliance is a canon and OC friendly, Discord-based, paragraph roleplay group accepting members...
body:
Stay at Heights Alliance!

Heights Alliance is a canon and OC friendly, Discord-based, paragraph roleplay group accepting members who are 16+. With multiple modes for character interactions (including group chats and direct messages), ours is an active and welcoming group always looking for new members! To learn more about the server, head over to our rules!

About | Rules | Characters

summary:
Overhaul: So, what do you say? Would you care to join and work under me?
Shigaraki: Uh, I better ask Kurogiri.
Overhaul: I shall...
body:
Overhaul: So, what do you say? Would you care to join and work under me?
Shigaraki: Uh, I better ask Kurogiri.
Overhaul: I shall wa-
Shigaraki: He said no.
Overhaul: You didn't even a-
Shigaraki: He said no.

dialogue.name: Overhaul
dialogue.label: Overhaul:
dialogue.phrase: So, what do you say? Would you care to join and work under me?

blog.name: isminetadeadyet
blog.title: Is Mineta Dead Yet?
blog.description: Has the godforsaken grape been smashed yet? Find out here as we count down the days until we celebrate with the finest of wine for the sweetest of victories.

summary: I hate the fact that mineta manure shares the first two letters with midoriya. I once accidentally blurted out "how dare you...
question: I hate the fact that mineta manure shares the first two letters with midoriya. I once accidentally blurted out "how dare you disrespect min*** like that" when i meant to say midoriya. Never have i felt myself dying so quickly inside
answer: i can imagine there was a bad aftertaste or even a sting on the tongue when you realized the mistake. it’s okay though, it was just an accident
